This alienation is a function of time in another way as well: the wille of the animal world is at once appetite and its satisfaction. It can be translated as desire or pleasure. The speaker’s despair is a consequence of the delay, the temporal lag, between wille as desire and wille as pleasure, a lag that threatens to extend indefinitely. 13 Barr, Chapter 4 ‘Modelling Holiness’
